title: The Future of IT: Questions, Challenges, and Expectations
description:
It’s probably one of the most interesting times to be in this industry since its very beginning. We’re witnessing a period where significant advancements in computing power, data storage, and complex patterns of information handling are building up towards a critical mass that will bring rather sooner than later a major technological leap for mankind. 
In the same time, the dawn of the post-classical computing era is already showing on the horizon. Quantum computing is challenging almost everything we know about computing and holds the promise to support giant leaps in the way we understand nature. 
Despite the awesome momentum, we (as an industry) are still facing significant challenges starting with the very way we develop and apply computer technology and ending with producing enough professionals to fill the skyrocketing needs at a global level.
Join me in this keynote session for an attempt to take an objective look at where we are right now and which are the directions we’re heading to.

title: Keynote: Software Craftsmanship
description: After over ten years since the Agile summit, software projects are still failing and developers are still behaving and being treated as factory workers. The software development industry is still very amateur when compared to other professions. How can we change this? Why Agile was not sufficient? Why so many clients are unhappy with their software projects? Why is it so difficult to find good developers? Our industry needs more professionalism and that’s what Software Craftsmanship brings to the table. In this talk Sandro will be explaining: what Software Craftsmanship really is, the value of technical practices, what it means to be a professional software developer and what to do to satisfy our customers.

speakers.name: Sandro Mancuso
speakers.title: Software Craftsman and co-founder of Codurance

title: Keynote: Fun & Fearless Leadership
description: The Fun & Fearless Leadership System is a set of leadership practices that I’ve developed based on my experience in software, as a developer, manager, consultant and entrepreneur, and I’ve put into the book of the same name, which I’m launching on this day, at Codecamp. In this session, I will address the remarkable conditions of Romanian IT and I’ll touch on some of the key ideas from my book, such as compassionate radical honesty, the need to hire better, fluent teams, stoic leadership, and some of the magic that we’ve had, partially lost, and still need more than ever.

title: Cloud pipeline for cleaning up large scale website traffic
description:
Accuracy and quality in reporting, for large e-Commerce companies like eMAG, can seriously be skewed by bot traffic. This affects every facet of decision making: forecasts, financial planning, commercial stocks, AB testing, etc. Identifying and filtering out bot traffic from reports requires a lot of signals, both internal and external.
This presentation highlights how we integrated Kafka, Airflow, Spark and Docker in a hybrid setup (internal and Google Cloud) in order to create a complete pipeline (from raw data to results).

title: You have the right to say NO
description: As kids we used to say NO a lot, like a whole lot, to things that were requested from us (wash your teeth, eat fruits, sleep etc ....). Now, as responsile working adults, NO seems to be the hardest word. Let's discuss in this session how sometimes a well-placed NO can save us time and keep us from getting into trouble.

title: New trends in Automotive Software – Adaptive Autosar
description:
The new trend in automotive software is the usage of Adaptive AUTOSAR in high performance computing. This leads to new challenges in the way how products are developed and especially how they are designed, bringing Continental closer to becoming a software company.

Making a step from a full AUTOSAR ECU development towards adaptive application development can be a challenge, but the base principles applied in SW architecture and design remain unchanged.

We will make a comparison concerning the design of applications in Classic and Adaptive AUTOSAR, covering aspects like: interfacing, static vs dynamic communication paths, multi-threading, servitization and debugging.

title: Resilience – do it like Netflix or “Chaos performance automation”
description: How does a system react to changes? How are runtime errors handled? This breakout deals with the term and the underlying concept Resilience. First, the shortcut provides an introduction to Resilient software design, then takes a closer look at Netflix. Netflix is regarded as a pioneer in the field of error prevention and checks itself by means of specially created errors. The shortcut also clarifies how Hystrix and Turbine arm the Spring Cloud in the event of a network and server outage disrupting the availability of microservices.

title: A brief look at React internals (fibers, coroutines and algebraic effects)
description: In this talk, we'll have a peek behind React's curtains with the hope of better understanding what makes async rendering (time slicing and suspense) possible. We'll talk about fibers, coroutines, and algebraic effects and see how they all come together to power the latest major iteration of Facebook's popular library.

title: From Redux and further - When to use a store and why?
description: Do you ever wonder what are the benefits of building an application using a managed state? Often we dive straight into Actions, Reducers and other store architecture associated terms, but those concepts, even though essential, are simply means to an end. From Flux to Redux and beyond, seems like stores have become so popular lately, there is a lot of information on store solutions, but limited answers on when or why should we use them? Are they really your single source of truth?

speakers.name: Olga Molocenco
speakers.title: Technical Support Engineer on Azure Big Data

title: Interaction Driven Design (IDD)
description:
How can we quickly tell what an application is about? How can we quickly tell what it does? How can we distinguish business concepts from architecture clutter? How can we quickly find the code we want to change? How can we instinctively know where to add code for new features?
In this talk Sandro will be sharing how he designed the last application he worked on, twisting a few concepts from Domain-Driven Design, properly applying MVC, borrowing concepts from CQRS, and structuring packages in non-conventional ways. Sandro will also be touching on SOLID principles, Agile incremental design, modularisation, and testing.
By iteratively modifying the project structure to better model the product requirements, he has come up with a design style that helps developers create maintainable and domain-oriented software. 
Target audience: developers, architects, Product Owners.

Microsoft new vision “Any Developer, Any App, Any Platform.” is getting closer to reality through .NET Core expansion in the world of IoT. .NET Core is here to stay!

title: Boy Meets Girl: A Machine Learning Deployment Story
description:
A tale as old as time: boy meets girl, girl asks boy to train a predictive model, boy succeeds. But when she discovers that he cannot operationalize said model, he is forced to go through a perilous journey into the strange and unfamiliar world of Azure Machine Learning deployment options. He learns to face his fears and evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of Azure Machine Learning Studio and Azure Machine Learning services, all the while hoping to redeem himself in the process.

Will he succeed? Will he manage to find an option that allows him to deploy a trained model as a web service, scale it, and consume it easily? Let’s find out!

title: Continuous Delivery in a Cloud Native World with Kubernetes and Spinnaker
description: Continuous delivery is a key practice that many software teams have adopted and embraced for long. It relies on automating the build, test, and deployment processes so that changes in code or in configuration will go through a series of validations that ultimately ensure the product gets shipped as quickly as it is developed and tested. With the velocity that the cloud brings, having solid proven tools and following best practices makes the difference. During this talk, you’ll see how to use both Kubernetes and Spinnaker along with other Google Cloud services to achieve continuous delivery in a reliable way and decide yourself if it’s right for you.

title: Why Unity is bad at graphics (Except it's not)
description:
In the world of game engines, two major titles fight for supremacy, while polarizing the game development communities: Unreal Engine and Unity.

The battle is neck-to-neck and both engines present impressive features that lure the game developers into changing sides. However, one aspect often causes Unity to appear poor in the eyes of some: Graphics.

While arguably not crucial for a game's success, for many, good graphics still act as an advocate for product superiority and still play a major role in marketing a product and attracting potential users.

Because this is rather a case of misunderstanding Unity's graphics capabilities than a proven fact, the mission here is to break the myth according to which Unity is bad at graphics by demonstrating how state-of-the-art graphics can be achieved with Unity  by anyone with minimum effort and impact. Various strategies, techniques, tips and tricks will be presented.

title: The ABC of Setting an Agile Team on a Path to High Performance
description:
So you want to build a kick-ass Agile team. But creating a successful balanced team dynamic can be challenging to achieve. Unfortunately, there’s no secret sauce, magic recipe, or tried-and-true formula to build a truly top-notch Agile team, which is what Agile is all about. It’s supposed to be different and ever-changing depending on each team and its circumstances.
 
 However, there are some generic steps you could take to build a pathway to high performance and make your Agile team realize the benefits of improved collaboration, more frequent software releases, and happier customers.
 
Join me as I will walk you through what it takes for an Agile team to graduate from a struggling team to a great one, what the risks are, and how you, as leader, can help your team along the way to greatness.

title: Cyber-security for the next generation, autonomous cars
description:
The car of tomorrow has a multitude of highly advanced tech for providing active safety, from sensor fusion, up to Car2x. It is also more than ever a connected car, part of the internet of things , "a mobile phone on wheels".
 This huge potential comes with increased risks and faces numerous threats.
 Automotive cyber-security addresses a broad areal of malicious interference, coming from different types of attackers. It proposes some already-well established but also new mechanisms and technologies to tackle the threats.
 Come to this presentation and "break the ice" on the subject.

title: Reinventing startup education - how to design higher education for startups?
description: For your startup to succeed, it needs to be educated. Both you – the founder – and your team must be open to accepting feedback, whether good or bad, in order to improve, move a step further and have realistic chances of climbing up the success ladder in entrepreneurship. Join us for an open talk with the Rubik mentors and startup founders who have looked for learnings in alternative educational programs such as: online schools, bootcamps, office hours and mentorship, trainings, conferences and educational events.

title: Using Deep Learning to Search for Oil and Gas
description:
Several areas of Earth with large accumulations of oil and gas also have huge deposits of salt below the surface. Salt bodies are known for their propensity to form nice oil traps. However, knowing where large salt deposits are precisely is very difficult. Professional seismic imaging still requires expert human interpretation of salt bodies. This leads to very subjective, highly variable renderings. More alarmingly, it leads to potentially dangerous situations for oil and gas company drillers. That's why the oil & gas industry is now employing AI-based approaches to automatically identify subsurface salt bodies. 

Come to this session to see how Deep Learning is used to scan underground seismic images, looking for potentially resource-rich areas. 

Python code included and publicly available! A basic understanding of how neural networks operate will be useful to get the most of this session.

title: Software development at cloud speed and mountain high
description: Why we should care about cloud native and simplified deployment process. I will share my experience on building and provisioning large scale data platform on the public cloud.

title: Codemods - JavaScript code refactoring made easy
description: Maintaining a codebase can be a frustrating experience for any developer, especially when we talk about legacy JavaScript, HTML and CSS codebases. Surprising or not this process can be automated, at least partially. Let's see together how to do that.

title: We've got 99 problems but the STATE ain't one
description: A talk about what problems you may encounter when managing the state in a React application, about how we handled some of them in our project and the other options we had.

title: Fast ways to create better products

We have the answers.

description: E despre momentul acela cand vrei sa intelegi mai mult, mult mai mult despre comportamentul utilizatorilor de produse digitale pentru ca vrei sa optimizezi. E despre momentul acela cand #OchiiNuMint. E despre comportament real, nu despre cel declarat in chestionare. E despre ceea ce lipseste probabil in multe din companiile romanesti: cercetare, cercetare, cercetare pentru inovare.

description:
“Somewhere there is a map of how it can be done. “ - Ben Stein.

title: Screwing up. The Automated Way
description: The story of my major screw-ups and lessons learned throughout the 6 years that I’ve spent as the only member of the Test Automation Team, designing and developing the company’s automated testing framework “from scratch”. I had to learn the hard way that, while, in a world of Testers, the Test Automation Engineer is seen as a superhero – with great power come endless possibilities of fucking shit up!

title: Communication in a microservice architecture
description:
Everybody wants to avoid the big, bad, ugly monoliths  and as an alternative they just gear towards "Microservices" - these awesome, world-changing, independent "micro" puzzle pieces.

Once you're on this perfect road you'll often see that simple HTTP calls are not enough anymore,  or that your app can't handle failures gracefully and then you switch to messaging. And then you fail. Again.

In this session we'll explore different ways of getting data from one 'micro-service' to another and while doing that we'll talk  about the benefits or the drawbacks of choosing an approach or another.

description:

title: Employer Branding, from HR to Marketing.
description:
Most employers want to be known for being a good place to work for, but it takes active management to drive this perception, both internally and externally. 
This is where employment branding comes in play. In this talk we will figure out together how a successful employer branding approach looks like from both a Marketing and HR perspective.

From employee experience to brand ambassadorship, we will address it all as we analyse specific case studies that relate to the Romanian reality of the work force.

title: Cum facilitezi fericirea la locul de munca
description:
In barca ta esti responsabil si iei initiativa cand vezi probleme sau oportunitati, dar la job?
Ce tine un angajat intr-o companie?
Cum faci ca angajatii sa simta ca apartin unui grup? 
Cum faci ca oamenii tai sa creasca?
Cum ii motivezi (nu doar financiar)?
Sunt intrebari la care am incercat sa gasesc raspunsul - prin experientele mele, discutand cu cei pe care ii coordonez, intreband manageri, documentandu-ma si sintetizand totul intr-o prezentare care poate sa inspire si sa ofere tactici si raspunsuri la intrebari pe care orice manager si le-a pus macar o data.

title: How to become a script kiddie in 30 minutes or less
description:
In this session I will try to demonstrate how easy it is to create a USB device that can act as a keyboard and DHCP server, which can be used to insert malicious scripts on a target machine. 

The point of this session is to raise awareness about all of the tools available to malicious actors and the ease at which these can be used. And because the things we're about to use are so simple, we get to become the hacker's community worst nightmare. A script kiddie.

title: The most overlooked funding source & how to handle it, legally
description: In a world where the number of investors is inversely proportional to the number of companies actually needing an investment, Tudor will delve into both operational and legal aspects that the founding team of a startup need to be aware of while selling their product and, thus, becoming a desired target for investors. Subjects approached will include: commercial agreements, sales tactics and their legal framing, founding team dynamics and how to make sure you don’t step on each other’s toes while handling sales.
